channel.title: Randomized Item Stats
channel.description:
Was wondering what you guys think about randomized items? Not completely random, for example :
Bronze 2hd Max Damage : 4 , 7 Iron 2hd Max Damage : 8 , 10 Steel 2hd Max Damage : 11 , 14 Black 2hd Maxe Damage : 15 , 18 Mithril 2hd Max Damage : 19 , 22 Addy 2hd Max Damage : 23 , 25 Rune 2hd Max Damage : 26 , 32
That's not exact of course, just an example. The stats would be generated when the item is first created and displayed when trading so there's no scams.

item.title: Randomized Item Stats
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

I only read OP so forgive me if this has already been said. I would say that adding randomized items is a good thing. If I were doing it myself I would borrow from other MMORPGs and add soulbound, durability and even some of the combat effects etc. I’d suggest working on a few new sprites for weapons/armor and just releasing ~100 or so new item names, some of which share the same models with different colours or what not.

This would add a gear grinding affect to the game and also means that not everyone is on a level playing field (which in games like these is a good thing). You only need to look at games like WoW to see that this technique keeps players hooked.

Currently in RSC you have the choice of: Full rune, with R2H and possibly some Dragon. There is nothing in RSC to keep people playing. I’m sure that almost everyone who plays now is playing more for nostalgia and social purposes than actual enjoyment of the game (that’s how I felt anyway). But I believe that’s because the game is too simple in its current form to maintain interest any more.

TL;DR: Add more armor and weapons to the game. Change the (imho) seriously basic combat system to add the typical RPG-style stats (there are lots of OS RPG games you can basically take the combat system/formulas from) and add stats to items.

item.title: Randomized Item Stats
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

An option could be to add charms into the game. So if you keep your charms in your inventory, you will gain a slight advantage in a specific area. Perhaps attack-charm, smithing-charm, gem-finding-charm etc. that each give an advantage to the attack skill, the smithing skill and the chance of finding a gem respectively. This advantage could be calculated either via an absolute number or a percentage depending on your current skill or whatever else would be reasonable (perhaps an absolute number when it comes to the gem-finding-charm). It should be balanced so that anyone with a lot of money cannot just buy all charms and gain an extreme advantage. Perhaps either only allow one or a few charms of the same type at once (in your inventory), and perhaps so they are not tradable?

item.title: Randomized Item Stats
item.dc:creator: @UAC_Marine UAC_Marine
item.description:
@UAC_Marine wrote:

Well it means that players will put extra work into acquiring many items as opposed to just looking for 1 item. Imagine masses of people all wanting the sacred rune 2 hander but only the lucky get to acquire it’s most powerful version. People would become obsessed with getting the perfect versions of their items. Also this means that in PVP you can face off against someone with the same armor/weapon types and still win by a mile if you worked on getting the best items.

So pro’s and con’s

Pro’s
People spending more time on your server.
A diverse economy.
Lots of traffic to your server for a great new system.

Con’s
People complaining they lost against someone wearing the same gear.

The way I see it this would greatly benefit a server.

P.S This could be done with all items like hatchets, pickaxes etc.
